zip.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: two lines of small metal or plastic pieces that slide together to fasten a piece of clothing
zip.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The zip on my skirt had broken.
Your zip’s undone at the back.
zip.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: This car goes with a bit more zip than my last one.
A spoonful of mustard will give the dish some zip.
zip.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: ‘How much money do you have left?’ ‘Zip!’
zip.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to fasten something using a zip
zip.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: ‘I’ll see you tomorrow, ’ said John, zipping his jacket.
He zipped open the case  (=unfastened it).
The two sleeping bags can be zipped together to make a double.
zip.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to go somewhere or do something very quickly
zip.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: We zipped through customs in no time.
zip.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to make a computer file smaller in order to store it or send it
